column4: I am running the LiveCD and need to know the command and options to run a fsck on /dev/sda1 and fix errors.
if its not mounted ' sudo fsck /dev/sda1'
use unzip whatever.zip
I said I did..
you said you used 7z
I said I used both.
Please read it again.
you could do a 'file whatever.zip' it may be the file is bad.
Okay, I'll try...
KALYWAY_LEO_10.5.1intel_SSE2_SSE3.zip: Zip archive data, at least v1.0 to extract --- And I've already downloaded this once before, it did the same thing. It works perfectly fine for other people.
Interesting.
its still possible its a messed up download.  I doubt if the site posts a md5sum however. Got a URL to the zip?
I have an md5sum.
md5sum whatever.zip  and see if they check out?
okay.
should this be taking this long to get the md5sum?
depends on the size of the zi[
depends on the size of the zip
about 3.5 gb.
that may take a bit.
how long did you mean by a bit? :S
it depends on your cpu.. the md5sum is a bit of a BIG task. on a 4gb file.. its accessing 4gb of data and  doing calculatons on it.
I'm reading that I might have to use winRAR to extract this.. does this mean it is impossible on Linux?
synaptic :)
